gurmukhi: bolq hY ipk kokl mor ikDO Gn my chUM Ern vw ky ]byg clo qum gokl ko qj puMn hjwr AbY qum gw ky ]150]
transliteration: Dolat Hai Pik Kokal Mor Kidhau Ghan Me Chahoon Oran Vaa Ke|| Beg Chalo Toum Gokal Ko Taj Pounn Hajaar Abai Toum Gad Ke||150||
translation: There the voice of peococks and nightingales is heard on all four sides, therefore we should leave Gokul immediately and go to Braja in order to earn the merit of thousands of virtuous actions.150.

gurmukhi: nMd sBY gopn snY bwq khI ieh Taur ]qij gokl biRj kO cly ieh qy BlI n Aaur ]151]
transliteration: Nand Sabhai Gopan Sanai Baat Kahieh Tharur|| Taj(i) Gokal Brij Kau Chale Eh Te Bhalina Aur||151||
translation: Nand said this to all the gopas that they should then leave Gokul for Braja, because there is no other good place like it.151.

gurmukhi: ltpt bwNDy auiT cly Awey jb biRj hIr ]dyiKE ApnY nYn Br bihqo jmnw nIr ]152]
transliteration: Latpat Baandhe Outh(i) Chale Aae Jab Brij Heer|| Dekhio Apnai Nain Bhar Baihto Jamnaa Neer||152||
translation: All of them tied their good quickly and came to Braja; there they saw the flowing waters of Yamuna.152.

gurmukhi: Awies pwiekY nMdih ko sB gopn jwie Bly rQ swjy ]bYT sBY iqn pY iqrIAw sMig gwvq jwq bjwvq bwjy ]
transliteration: Oois Paaekai Nandah(i) Ko Sabh Gopan Jaae Bhale Rath Saaje|| Baith Sabhai Tin Pai Tireeaa San(i) Gadvat Jaat Bajaavat Baaje||
translation: With the concurrence of Nand, all the gopas decorated their chariots, the women sat in them and they started with the resonance of their musical instruments;

gurmukhi: hym ko dwnu krY ju doaU hir god ley jsuDw iem rwjy ]kYDau sYl suqw igr BIqr aUc mno mn nIl ibrwjy ]153]
transliteration: Hem Ko Daan(u) Darai Ju Dooo Har(i) God Lae Jasudhaa Im Raaje|| Kaidhau Sail Soutaa Gir Bheetar Ooch Mano Man Neel Biraaje||153||
translation: Yashoda looks impressive with Krishna in her lap; it seems that she has obtained this good reward after offering gold in charity; Yashoda seems like a rock in the mountain and Krishna in her lap appears like a sapphire.153.

gurmukhi: gop gey qj gokl kO biRj Awpny Awpny fyrn Awey ]fwr deI lsIAw Aru A`Cq bwhir BIqir DUp jgwey ]
transliteration: Gop Gad Taj Goakal Kau Brij Aapne Deran Aae|| Daar Daidailaseeaa Ar(u) Achchhat Baahar(i) Dhoop Jagade||
translation: The gopas forsaking Gokul came to their abodes in Braja; they sprinkled buttermild and fragrances and burnt incenses within their houses and outside;

gurmukhi: qw Cib ko js au`c mhwN kib nY muK qy iem BwK sunwey ]rwj ibBICn dY ikDO lMk ko rwm jI Dwm piv`qR krwey ]154]
transliteration: Taa Chhab(i) Ko Jas Ouchch Mahaan Kabi Nai Moukh Te Im Bhaakh Sounaae|| Raaj Bibheechhan Dai Kidhau Lank Ko Raam Jidhaam Pavittra Karaae||154||
translation: The great poet has said about this beautiful scene that it seemed to him that after bestowing the kingdom of Lanka on Vibhishana, Ram had purified Lanka again.154.

gurmukhi: gop sBY ibj pur ibKY bYTy hrK bFwie ]Ab mY lIlw kiRSn kI muK qy khoN sunwie ]155]
transliteration: Gop Sabhai Bij Pur Bikhai Baithe Harakh Badhaae|| Ab Mai Leelaa Krishan Kimoukh Te Kahon Sounaae||155||
translation: All the gopas were delighted to be in Braja and now I narrate the wonderful sports of Krishna.155.

gurmukhi: swiq bqIq Bey jb swl lgy qb kwnH crwvn g`aUAw ]pwq bjwvq AO murlI iml gwvq gIq sBY lrk`aUAw ]
transliteration: Saat(i) Bateet Bhae Jab Saal Lage Tab Kaahn Charaavan Gadoaa|| Paat Bajaavat Au Murlimil Gadvat Geet Sabhai Larkaooaa||
translation: After seven years Krishna began to graze cows, he produced tunes by combining the leaves of the papal tree and all the boys began to sing on the tune of the flute;
